Description: Two small textile fragments of fine, undyed linen cloth (mummy-wrapping?). a) has part of a selvedge fringe, identified as Deir el-Bahri type 1(De Jonghe Fig.3) with discontinuous weft; other edges are torn and ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.36 ends per 10mm and weft 15 picks per 10mm. b) small fragment of linen cloth; medium-fine quality, without feature except for a black mark - possibly modern ink. Undyed, now dark cream. Worn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.26 ends per 10mm and weft 16 picks per 10mm.
Cultures/periods: Middle Kingdom (? b) is later than a))
Curator's comments: Fringe of a) has not been fully analysed. Some weft pricks are not reaching the selvedge. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
